mdRecord.dcterms:title: Rouss Hall, Physical laboratory
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Thompson, Ralph R.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Notation on back, "Graduate students in the Rouss Physical laboratory work on an apparatus for the development of high electrical potentials and for the study of high speed electrons. The University of Virginia has strong graduate and research programs in all the natural sciences, astronomy, botany, chemistry, genetics, geology, physics, psychology, and zoology, as well as the medical sciences and the engineering sciences--and is the only university in the whole South with so broad a program in the natural sciences."
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
